item.description: AccorHotels, a major player in the travel and hospitality industry, is expanding its luxury presence in the Asia Pacific region with multiple high-end hotel openings scheduled in the coming months. This initiative will primarily involve the expansion of their Sofitel and Pullman brands, which are part of AccorHotels’ luxury and upscale portfolio. Other prestigious brands in this collection include Raffles Hotel, Fairmont, MGallery by Sofitel, Swissôtel, and Grand Mercure. These openings follow the successful August debut of the Sofitel Kuala Lumpur Damansara, a 312-room establishment situated in the heart of Malaysia’s capital city.

item.title: Mandarin Orchard and Marina Mandarin in Singapore are now providing free local smartphone services
item.description: The Mandarin Orchard Singapore and Marina Mandarin Singapore have added a convenient amenity to all guestrooms: “handy,” a smartphone solution. This provides registered guests with complimentary unlimited 4G data, local and international calls, online city guides, and ticket booking services for Singapore attractions. Both hotels are managed by Meritus Hotels & Resorts. With handy now available in all 1,077 rooms at Mandarin Orchard Singapore and 575 rooms at Marina Mandarin Singapore, guests can stay connected while exploring Singapore using their own personalized smartphone outside the hotel.

item.title: The Hyatt Regency Danang Resort & Spa is offering meeting packages for the year 2017
item.description: Source: Hyatt Regency Danang Resort & Spa. Executive team members at Hyatt Regegncy Danang Resort & Spa will help event planners make any meeting a success. Located on Vietnam’s Hoi An coastline and close to Danang, the Hyatt Regency Danang Resort & Spa has announced new meeting packages for 2017. The resort offers a wide range of event and meeting spaces, both indoors and outdoors on the beachfront. These venues can accommodate up to 250 people.

item.title: Discover the hidden secrets of Balinese sarongs with the Sarong Concierge program at the Ritz-Carlton Bali
item.description: The Ritz-Carlton, Bali has introduced a new program called the Sarong Concierge to enhance its immersive cultural experiences. Guests can participate in this half-day journey led by Tresna Dewi, the resort’s Sarong Concierge, to learn about various Balinese textiles and their creation. Known as ‘kamen’ in Balinese, these fabrics are transformed into beautiful, intricately made sarongs. Worn by both men and women across Southeast Asia and the Arabian Peninsula, sarongs hold cultural significance in Bali and are worn for various occasions.

item.title: March and April dining promotions are being shared by Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
item.description: Source: Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy. Braised beancurd, with salted egg in the background. The Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy is offering several dining deals throughout March and April 2016. One promotion focuses on Teochew porridge with side dishes created by Head Chef Victor Lee Appu at the Jia Wei Chinese Restaurant. Teochew porridge, a classic dish from Eastern Guangdong, China, is a staple for the Teochew people. Unlike Cantonese congee, the Singaporean version is prepared without broth and served with a variety of accompanying dishes and condiments.

item.title: Fit Spotting assists users in finding hotels that have excellent gym facilities
item.description: Fit Spotting is an iOS mobile application that helps users discover, evaluate, and read reviews about hotel gyms and fitness facilities. Tarek Atwan, the creator of Fit Spotting, explained that as a frequent traveler and fitness enthusiast, he found it challenging to locate reliable reviews and images of hotel gyms while booking accommodations. Information was scattered across the internet, lacking a central platform where users could access consolidated feedback, ratings, and photos to accurately depict the hotel’s fitness offerings.

item.title: Dusit Thani Bangkok will reopen in September 2024
item.description: Dusit Hotels and Resorts, a prominent Thai hotel and property development company, will reopen the famous Dusit Thani Bangkok on September 27, 2024, as a key component of Dusit Central Park. Starting May 1, 2024, reservations for the new Dusit Thani Bangkok can be made through their website, with early birds receiving a US$75 nightly credit for dining and spa treatments, among other benefits. Rates begin at US$330++ per night. Bookings made by October 31, 2024, for stays between September 27, 2024, and March 31, 2025, are eligible for this promotion.

item.title: Everything is going well at PARKROYAL on Beach Road
item.description: Beginning January 16, 2017, PARKROYAL on Beach Road will be offering a new take on Lunar New Year celebrations as Executive Chef Ken Ang introduces his culinary perspective to the dishes at Plaza Brasserie, their all-day dining restaurant. Known for his mastery of traditional Cantonese roasting methods, Executive Chef Ang will be presenting his version of the lucky facai yusheng (发财鱼生, also called lohei), enhanced with additions like crispy salmon and chicken skin.

item.title: This year, Teardrop Hotels is introducing three new tea plantation experiences in Sri Lanka
item.description: Teardrop Hotels is expanding its portfolio in 2018 with the addition of three renovated tea planters’ houses: Goatfell, Nine Skies, and Pekoe House. These vintage managers’ bungalows, located along the tea country route, will offer a modern take on traditional tea plantation accommodations. Opening in April 2018, Goatfell is a former superintendent’s residence situated on a working tea estate above Nuwara Eliya. This four-bedroom main house, with two additional standalone chalets, boasts living and dining rooms and a swimming pool.

item.title: The Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo has officially opened its doors
item.description: Source: The Ascott Limited. The lobby, Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo. CapitaLand’s serviced residence branch, The Ascott Limited, opened its first high-end serviced residence in Japan on March 30, 2017, under its top brand, Ascott The Residence. The 130-unit Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo is in the desirable Marunouchi-Otemachi district. It’s part of a mixed-use development with offices and close to notable attractions like the Imperial Palace East Gardens and the Ginza area. The residence provides convenient access to Otemachi Station, a major Tokyo subway hub served by five lines, with connections to the Shinkansen bullet train available from nearby Tokyo Station.

item.title: Sofitel Kunming provides convenient access to the city center
item.description: Sofitel, the luxury hotel brand under AccorHotels, has launched its newest property, Sofitel Kunming. Located in the city center, it’s the only international luxury hotel in Kunming. Situated in Kunming’s central business district, the 400-room hotel spans the 27th to 52nd floors. It showcases a blend of French elegance and art de vivre with touches of Yunnan’s vibrant ethnic cultures and customs. “The debut of Sofitel Kunming signifies a period of rapid growth for AccorHotels in China, as we continue to solidify our dedication to delivering world-renowned, refined French hospitality to discerning Chinese travelers,” shared Paul Richardson, Chief Operating Officer of AccorHotels Greater China.

item.title: SilverNeedle Hospitality has introduced its second Sage Hotel in Perth
item.description: Source: SilverNeedle Hospitality. SilverNeedle Hospitality, based in Singapore, is expanding its upscale Sage Hotel brand in Perth, Western Australia, with a second location. This announcement comes just weeks after the brand launched with a hotel in Brisbane. Iqbal Jumabhoy, Managing Director & Group Chief Executive Officer at SilverNeedle Hospitality, stated that Sage Hotels are designed for a specific type of business traveler: one who wants a consistent and straightforward experience while working in new cities.

item.title: Participate in the early bird iftar promotion at the Shangri-La Hotel Dubai
item.description: From June 18th to July 17th, 2015, the Shangri-La Hotel Dubai is offering a special promotion for iftar. Starting at sunset, Dunes Café will serve a selection of traditional Arabic dishes from across the region, along with special beverages and an assortment of desserts. For the first week of Ramadan, the buffet at Dunes Café is priced at AED150 per person. After the first week, the price will be AED175 per person.

item.title: Experience the unique Kampong culinary specials at the Intercontinental Kuala Lumpur
item.description: This June, the Intercontinental Kuala Lumpur in Malaysia is offering a special deal for gatherings with colleagues, business contacts, and potential clients. The promotion is valid in their newly renovated ballrooms and private function rooms. Source: Intercontinental Kuala Lumpur website. For every ten paying guests, one person can attend for free. The Selera Kampong package is priced at RM155 nett per adult, while the Kampong Boys Special is RM172 nett per adult.

item.title: Celebrate the successful first year of Hyatt Regency Suzhou with our Anniversary Meeting Package
item.description: Source: Hyatt Regency Suzhou. The Hyatt Regency Suzhou is commemorating its first anniversary with various special offers as a thank you to its loyal and valued guests for their support throughout the year. Having opened its doors on August 24, 2014, in the Suzhou Industrial Park (SIP), the conveniently located Hyatt Regency Suzhou boasts 355 rooms and suites. Amenities include a Regency Club, five dining options, and over 15,000 square feet of space for events.

item.title: Guests at ibis Singapore on Bencoolen can enjoy complimentary calls and data with the smartphone service provided
item.description: The ibis Singapore on Bencoolen hotel now offers guests a “handy” smartphone service with unlimited 3G internet, free local and international calls, and a comprehensive Singapore city guide. Source: Accor. The handy smartphone. This service, included in the ’extra benefits’ room package, provides a smartphone for use both within the hotel and around Singapore, allowing guests to stay connected and navigate the city without incurring high data charges. The “handy” phone also aligns with the hotel’s sustainability goals by replacing printed materials like in-room directories with a digital alternative and offering information about the hotel’s environmentally friendly initiatives.

item.title: BudgetHotels.sg has launched a newly enhanced website
item.description: Source: BudgetHotels.sg website. BudgetHotels.sg, the online guide for finding hotels, recently updated its website to offer a smoother booking experience for affordable accommodations in Singapore. The redesigned website prioritizes mobile use and faster loading speeds. It allows users to filter hotels by price, ranging from one to four stars. The price categories include: Less than S$50 S$50 - $79 S$80 - $119 S$120 - $149 More than S$150 Making the website mobile-friendly was a key decision based on the latest trends in the hospitality sector.

item.title: The InterContinental Dubai Marina is now accepting advance bookings for Marina Social
item.description: Source: InterContinental Dubai Marina. Atherton. The InterContinental Dubai Marina has announced the official opening date for Marina Social and The Social Room, the first restaurant in the region from Michelin-starred UK chef Jason Atherton. Located in the heart of Dubai Marina, the restaurant and bar will begin taking reservations on August 2nd and will open to the public on September 4th. Marina Social will bring Jason Atherton’s signature style of refined yet approachable dining to the recently opened InterContinental Dubai Marina.

item.title: La Yeon is now offering its Spring Menu
item.description: Source: The Shilla Seoul. La Yeon’s chilled pen shell salad with yuzu garlic sauce. La Yeon, the three-Michelin-starred Korean restaurant at The Shilla Seoul, renowned for its place on Asia’s 50 Best Restaurants list for three years running, introduces its new Spring Menu. This menu highlights the season’s freshest ingredients sourced directly from the Korean peninsula, reflecting La Yeon’s dedication to celebrating Korea’s rich culinary traditions. The Spring Menu presents delicacies like geoduck, sea bream, king scallops, webfoot octopus, napa cabbage, mulberries, and bellflower seeds.

item.title: Capella Shanghai, Jian Ye Li blends traditional shikumen architecture with modern French elegance
item.description: Source: Capella Shanghai website. Villa entrance. Located in Shanghai’s French Concession, the Capella Shanghai, Jian Ye Li, offers a journey back to the city’s early 20th-century charm. Situated within the Jian Ye Li estate, the property is a rare surviving example of Shanghai’s “shikumen” townhouses, characterized by their three-story brick construction and stone accents. The goal was to develop an ultra-luxury experience while meticulously preserving the site’s historical character. Jaya Interior Design and BLINK Design Group drew inspiration from Shanghai’s past, seamlessly integrating traditional Chinese elements with French elegance.

item.title: The Autograph Collection is ready to make its first appearance in Australia
item.description: Australian companies have a new, upscale event location. Pier One Sydney Harbour is joining the Autograph Collection, a curated group of almost 60 unique hotels globally. This harborside hotel provides a picturesque setting for meetings and events, featuring eight meeting rooms with expansive water views. Source: Marriott International. From Sydney to San Diego - Autograph Collection set to debut in three new world class destinations, including Pier One Sydney Harbour in Sydney, Australia.

item.title: The Burj Al Arab Terrace redefines the limits of construction, design, architecture, and hospitality
item.description: Source: Jumeirah Group. The Burj Al Arab Terrace. The Burj Al Arab Terrace, located in Dubai’s most famous hotel, is a unique combination of a restaurant, pool, beach, and cabana area. Constructed using innovative marine and off-site methods, this structure represents a world-first. Marine construction experts ADMARES developed the terrace at a shipyard in Finland, transporting it to Dubai in eight separate sections by ship. This approach minimized any negative impact on hotel guests, the ocean floor, and marine life.

item.title: The Ritz-Carlton is now open in Fukuoka
item.description: Source: The Ritz-Carlton. Facade, The Ritz-Carlton, Fukuoka. The Ritz-Carlton, Fukuoka, the newest addition to Marriott Bonvoy’s 31 hotel brands, has opened its doors on Japan’s Kyushu island. This hotel aims to blend the brand’s signature service and modern design with Fukuoka’s unique blend of history, tradition, culinary richness, and burgeoning startup culture. According to Tina Edmundson, President of Luxury for Marriott International, the opening marks the brand’s seventh hotel in Japan and solidifies its presence in a new and growing market.

item.title: Cristal Group has created a unique multilingual reservations tool that does not charge commissions
item.description: Cristal Group is set to become the first hotel chain globally to introduce its own commission-free reservation platform, aiming to offer more affordable hotel bookings. This month, a new multilingual website will be launched, powered by a proprietary booking engine. According to Kamal Fakhoury, Cristal’s Chief Operating Officer, this new platform will simplify the booking process for Cristal Hotels, featuring language options such as Arabic and Chinese, among others. He stated, “With hotels in Abu Dhabi, Iraq, Lebanon, and upcoming properties in Saudi Arabia, we are building a global customer base.

item.title: Sukhothai Shanghai is set to make its debut in late 2017
item.description: Source: HKRI. The Sukhothai Shanghai. HKR International will soon expand its Sukhothai Hotels & Resorts portfolio with a second hotel – The Sukhothai Shanghai. This new addition, situated in the Nanjing Road West central business district, is set to launch in late 2017. Designed by Neri & Hu, The Sukhothai Shanghai is a contemporary luxury boutique hotel. It offers 168 guest rooms and 33 suites, ranging from 44 to 172 square meters in size.

item.title: Experience the Peranakan Food Festival at Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
item.description: The Peranakan* Food Festival is making a comeback at the Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy! The hotel is bringing back this popular food festival with new additions to the menu, such as ayam masak rebung lemak (chicken with bamboo shoots in spicy gravy). Returning favorites include bubur cha cha (tapioca in coconut milk) and much more. Guests can explore booths showcasing Peranakan heritage at the Feast@East Buffet Restaurant. From June 10th to 19th, enjoy a variety of seafood at Feast@East Buffet Restaurant, featuring Chilean blue mussels, spanner crabs, and other crustacean favorites.

item.title: Food&HotelAsia will be larger and improved in 2016
item.description: Ting speaking at a media preview for FHA. Food&HotelAsia (FHA), a major food and hospitality trade show in Asia, is approaching its 40th anniversary of serving the industry’s needs. Since its 1978 inception, FHA has attracted a predominantly international exhibitor base (over 80%), underscoring its global reach. FHA provides a platform for showcasing innovative products, technologies, and solutions from around the world, facilitating connections and business opportunities for trade buyers and sellers.

item.title: Get away to The Meydan Hotel or Bab Al Shams Desert Resort & Spa this summer
item.description: Source: Meydan Hotels & Hospitality website. Meydan Hotels & Hospitality is offering a summer promotion called “The Great Escape” for AED 490 per night at both Bab Al Shams Desert Resort & Spa and The Meydan Hotel until September 30, 2015. This offer is well-suited for short business trips. Located a 45-minute drive from the city, Bab Al Shams Desert Resort & Spa provides an authentic desert experience amidst the sand dunes.

item.title: Coral Beirut Al Hamra now offers two additional Ambassador Suites as part of its room options
item.description: The Coral Beirut Al Hamra Hotel recently introduced a new suite category featuring expansive rooftop terraces with outdoor seating areas. Situated on the 11th floor, the 87 square meter Ambassador Suites offer fully equipped kitchens, large living rooms, and luxurious bathrooms, complete with high-end amenities. Hartmut Grauel, General Manager of the hotel, stated that these new suites cater to the preferences of discerning travelers. He noted a consistent demand for spacious accommodations akin to full-size apartments, complete with kitchens and living rooms.

item.title: Group discounts are available for the iftar buffet at Coral Beach Resort Sharjah
item.description: Source: Coral Beach Resort Sharjah website. The Coral Beach Resort Sharjah, having just finished a full update of its rooms and amenities, is offering an iftar buffet at its Al Bahar Restaurant. The buffet will feature a variety of traditional Arabic and international dishes, with options like mixed grills, shawarma, hot and cold mezze, stews and biryani, in addition to soups, salads, snacks, and customary Ramadan beverages. Jean Pierre Simon, the Regional General Manager for Northern Emirates at Coral Hotels & Resorts, highlighted Al Bahar restaurant as the perfect location for gatherings to break the fast, suggesting guests round off their dining experience with classic Ramadan sweets like the ever-popular umm Ali and mouhalabia.

item.title: Holiday Inn Dubai - Al Barsha has been awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence for the fifth year in a row
item.description: The Holiday Inn Dubai – Al Barsha has received the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence Hall of Fame award. This award recognizes outstanding hospitality businesses that consistently earn high ratings from travelers on TripAdvisor. The Hall of Fame honors businesses that have earned a Certificate of Excellence for five years in a row. This year, along with the hotel itself, two of its restaurants also received TripAdvisor awards: The Royal Budha, recognized in the category of Fine Dining – Thai, and the Gharana, recognized for Casual Dining – Indian.

item.title: Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Dubai ranked among the top 10 cities for hotel Wi-Fi speeds
item.description: Hotelwifitest.com, a website that evaluates hotel Wi-Fi quality, has published a list of cities ranked by the percentage of hotels with subpar Wi-Fi. Stockholm earned the top spot for hotel Wi-Fi satisfaction, followed by Hong Kong and Amsterdam. Source: Hotelwifitest.com The company suggests travelers verify Wi-Fi quality before making a hotel reservation. Hotelwifitest.com not only provides a platform for users to test their upload, download, and latency speeds but also showcases hotels that have undergone testing.

item.title: The Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong and Vistajet provide a rare and unique experience called Once in a Blue Moon
item.description: VistaJet, a prominent business aviation company, has partnered with the Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong to create the “Once in a Blue Moon” experience. This exclusive offer celebrates the Mid-Autumn Festival with a luxurious private jet journey featuring an in-flight menu designed by Chef Wong, the Executive Chinese Chef of the Michelin-starred Man Wah restaurant at the Mandarin Oriental. Available from September 15 to October 15, 2020, this unique offering features a customized private jet experience departing from Hong Kong.

item.title: Ibis Styles Singapore on MacPherson hosts its first charity event of the year-end
item.description: Source: Ibis Styles Singapore on MacPherson. The poolside. Ibis Styles Singapore on MacPherson will host its first charity event with the Friends of The Disabled Society (FDS) as part of their year-end festivities. The public can purchase various handicrafts and accessories on November 17, 2016, at the hotel’s lounge area and poolside. All proceeds will go to FDS. The hotel will also host a dinner for FDS on December 3, 2016, as part of the holiday celebrations.

item.title: Hyatt Regency is back in Sydney and is now focusing on positioning the hotel for MICE events
item.description: Hyatt Hotels announced that a hotel situated at 161 Sussex Street, previously operating under the Four Points by Sheraton brand, will transition to Hyatt Regency Sydney starting November 30, 2016. This change signifies the return of the Hyatt Regency brand to Sydney. The company is strategically positioning the Hyatt Regency Sydney as a prime location for conferences. The introduction of Hyatt Regency Sydney aligns with the growing demand for business, meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions (MICE), as well as leisure travel within the Australian market.

item.title: Join us in Asia at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group to celebrate the holiday season
item.description: To celebrate the holiday season, the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group is offering special packages at several of its Asian properties. Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong Source: Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong website. Mother with daughter in a Christmas setting. The hotel will be adorned with festive decorations, and guests will be treated to classic Christmas treats. Starting from HKD4,200 per night, the Winter Getaway package, available from December 1, 2018, to January 6, 2019, includes accommodations, daily breakfast for two, and special holiday amenities.

item.title: Experience an international Iftar at StraitsKitchen
item.description: Source: Grand Hyatt Singapore website. For the observance of Ramadan, StraitsKitchen at the Grand Hyatt Singapore welcomes guests to experience a wide array of Asian flavors. Their iftar buffet features dishes from various countries, including Indonesia, India, Lebanon, Saudi Arabia, and Turkey, alongside Singaporean favorites. All food is freshly made in halal-certified kitchens. Guests can expect Middle Eastern specialties such as roasted leg of lamb from Saudi Arabia, Lebanese grilled fish (samke harra), shawarma, Moroccan mezze, and classic desserts like baklava, basbousa, and kanafa bil cream.

item.title: The Hilton bans shark fin to align with the changing attitudes towards the Chinese delicacy
item.description: In February 2014, the Hilton group made an impactful announcement: it would eliminate shark fin from all of its 96 owned and managed properties in Asia Pacific by April 1, 2014. This decision was a significant blow to the waning popularity of the dish, once a staple at Chinese banquets. [Image of shark fin served with scallops and crabmeat] This decision was the culmination of a gradual phase-out. In December 2012, Hilton stopped readily offering shark fin at its managed properties in China and Southeast Asia, making it available only upon request.

item.title: Crowne Plaza Changi Airport is offering mooncakes in a suitcase
item.description: Crowne Plaza Changi Airport has launched its 2016 mooncake collection, featuring classic baked and contemporary snowskin varieties. These halal-certified treats are packaged in a stylish metal suitcase, making them a great gift for colleagues or loved ones. For those who prefer a traditional taste, baked mooncakes are available in three flavors: White Lotus Paste with Double Egg Yolk, White Lotus Paste with Single Egg Yolk, and White Lotus Paste with Melon Seeds.

item.title: Accor has moved its luxury and upscale team to Singapore in order to concentrate on the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Accor has shifted its Global Luxury and Upscale marketing hub from Paris to Singapore, demonstrating the Asia Pacific region’s increasing significance in these markets. The company stated that Asian consumers now represent nearly half of all luxury purchases worldwide. This shift implies that MICE organizers may need to elevate their events in this region to meet the expectations of attendees from the area. “Asian travelers are very particular, and the hotel standards in this region are very high.

item.title: The Ritz-Carlton in Amman makes its first appearance
item.description: Marriott Bonvoy’s luxury brand, The Ritz-Carlton, has opened a new hotel in Amman, Jordan, located in the city’s well-regarded Fifth Circle. The 20-story hotel boasts 228 rooms, with offerings ranging from standard guest rooms to 34 suites. Donna McNamara, Vice President and Global Brand Leader for The Ritz-Carlton, expressed the brand’s enthusiasm, stating their goal is to provide exceptional service and unique experiences in captivating destinations worldwide. She emphasized that The Ritz-Carlton, Amman, aims to immerse guests in luxury, creating memorable experiences and showcasing the city’s allure.

item.title: Langkawi hotels are prominently featured in the top 10 Travelers' Choice awards on TripAdvisor
item.description: In 2015, TripAdvisor’s Travelers’ Choice Awards recognized four Langkawi hotels in their top 10 for Malaysia. Additionally, Shangri-La properties secured two spots within the top 10, with a third ranking 11th. Source: TripAdvisor website. The Danna Langkawi Malaysia. Here are the top 10 hotels: The Danna Langkawi Malaysia, Pantai Kok, holds a 5 out of 5 rating from 1,777 reviews. It received an “excellent” rating from 1,508 reviewers, and “very good” from 203 reviewers.

item.title: Hilton ranks among the top three employers in the hospitality industry in Greater China
item.description: Source: Hilton. Hilton earned the title of Best Hospitality Company to Work For in Greater China. For the second year in a row, Hilton has secured a spot among the top three companies to work for in Greater China, according to the global research and consulting firm Great Place To Work Institute. Holding the highest position among hospitality companies on the 2016 list, Hilton also received recognition from 51job Inc.

item.title: Ibis Hotels partners with Deezer to create a musical experience
item.description: Source: Accor Hotels. Ibis Hotels, a budget-friendly option within the Accor group, has launched a new campaign in Australia. Through a partnership with Deezer, a global music streaming platform, guests can now immerse themselves in the world of music. This collaboration gives guests staying at ibis, ibis Styles, and ibis Budget hotels access to ibis PLAY, a dedicated microsite. This platform offers a variety of music-centric content, including regularly updated local concert listings, curated playlists, music news, artist interviews, photo galleries, exclusive ibis content, and a spotlight on Australian live acts.

item.title: Sunway's Resort Cafe provides a range of dining options from breakfast to dinner, perfect for business meetings
item.description: Source: Sunway. The recently opened Resort Cafe, situated on the lobby level of the luxurious Sunway Resort Hotel and Spa, accommodates 362 guests and showcases the diverse culinary heritage of Malaysia’s Malay, Chinese, and Indian populations. Spanning 17,588 square feet, the restaurant presents eight distinct culinary themes: the impressive Monumental Fruit and Salad Towers, Malay Archipelago (featuring dishes from Malaysia, Singapore, and Indonesia), Indo-Chine (showcasing cuisine from Thailand and Vietnam), Oriental Far East (highlighting dishes from Japan, Korea, and China), Spices of India, Mirage of the Gulf (offering dishes from the Middle East), Best from the West (featuring Western comfort food, grills, rotisserie, and churrasco), and a dedicated dessert section.

item.title: The KL Journal provides a unique boutique option for accommodations in Kuala Lumpur, as an alternative to traditional hotel chains
item.description: Source: The KL Journal. This hotel blends industrial design, diverse local touches, and vintage pieces to create a stylishly modern yet retro atmosphere. Located near Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur’s primary shopping and entertainment area, the Kuala Lumpur Journal (KL Journal) is a boutique hotel designed for the modern traveler seeking an alternative to large chains. It offers all the necessary modern amenities while retaining a unique sense of style and personality.

item.title: Cachet Hotel Group unveils the fresh appearance of URBN Shanghai
item.description: The Cachet Hotel Group (CHG) has revamped its stylish URBN Hotel in Shanghai, a former warehouse. Led by CHG’s renowned fashion designer, Jay Godfrey, the updated interiors offer guests a modern, zen-like ambiance. The use of recycled and reclaimed wood materials adds a natural touch, further enhanced by the neutral color scheme. Source: CHG. The Jay Godfrey Courtyard Suite. Photo - http://photos.prnasia.com/prnh/20140911/0861406560 The URBN Shanghai boasts a unique Jay Godfrey-designed suite.

The Six Senses Kaplankaya. The Six Senses Kaplankaya resort, which became part of Six Senses Hotels Resorts Spas on May 1, 2017, commences its new season on May 1, 2018. The property now aligns with Six Senses’ standards of design, sustainability, and wellness, offering a distinct guest experience focused on achieving equilibrium and well-being by engaging all the senses.

item.title: Embark on an artistic adventure with Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong
item.description: Source: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong website. The rooms showcase artwork by Don Low, including this mural featuring durians. Hotel Indigo encourages guests to embark on a journey of artistic discovery with its #staysurprised campaign. Explore some of Singapore’s most impressive street art, all within a 15-minute radius of the Katong neighborhood. The Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong boasts 131 rooms adorned with murals created by local urban artist Don Low. His work highlights Singapore’s passion for traditional cuisine.

item.title: The focus in the Philippines is on its beautiful beaches
item.description: Source: TripAdvisor website. The Atlantis Dive Resorts Dumaguete. TripAdvisor’s Travelers’ Choice Awards for accommodations in the Philippines in 2015 were distributed relatively evenly between hotels located in Manila and seaside resorts. The top ten awardees are as follows: Atlantis Dive Resorts Dumaguete in Dauin, Philippines, received 189 out of 235 “excellent” reviews. item.title: The Landmark Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong has become more environmentally friendly than ever
item.description: The Landmark Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong is implementing environmentally friendly practices to offer guests sustainable luxury, including producing its own eco-friendly water and starting a rooftop garden. The hotel is the first in Hong Kong to work with Nordaq FRESH, a Swedish company, to provide filtered and purified water in reusable glass bottles. This system reduces plastic waste and carbon emissions associated with traditional bottled water. Guests can also refill BPA-free bottles at the hotel.

item.title: Details of the farewell accommodation package at The Excelsior, Hong Kong are provided below
item.description: To commemorate its rich history, The Excelsior, Hong Kong is offering a special “Fond Farewell Room Package” for guests to experience the hotel one last time before its closure on March 31, 2019. Guests who book this package will also be invited to a special farewell reception in the hotel lobby. Three package options are available, each highlighting the four-star hotel’s renowned Michelin-star cuisine and its prime location on the Victoria Harbour waterfront for the past 45 years.

item.title: Five Asian hotels are ranked in the top 25 of Expedia Insiders' Select 2014
item.description: Expedia unveiled its 2014 Insiders’ Select list in early July. This list highlights the best hotels globally, as determined by almost two million verified customer reviews and Expedia’s own travel experts. Source: Blue Karma Resort website. Out of over 290,000 bookable properties on Expedia’s global websites, 650 hotels received the Insiders’ Select designation in 2014. Here are a few of the top 25 hotels from this year’s list: 2. item.title: Experience the Singapore F1 promotion at BIG Hotel
item.description: Source: BIG Hotel. Travelers can take advantage of a Formula One promotion at Singapore’s BIG Hotel. Bookings made by September 12th will receive a 10% discount on room rates, complimentary Wi-Fi throughout their stay, and access to free on-demand movies. This offer is valid for stays during the F1 night race in Singapore, from September 18th to 21st. The hotel is conveniently situated on Middle Road, a short distance from Bras Basah station.

item.title: Indulge in a luxurious 20 Carat Gold Escape with JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay and Maserati
item.description: Source: JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay. The lobby lounge. Upon arrival at the sports university-themed JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay, guests will be greeted with a luxurious Maserati transfer*. Building on the success of the resort’s previous collaboration showcasing DMC’s SS2017 womenswear collection, this partnership with Maserati aims to captivate those passionate about sports and automobiles. Ty Collins, General Manager at JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay, states, “This collaboration amplifies the resort’s commitment to offering design-focused experiences.

item.title: Observe the fireworks display on February 11 at the Regent Hong Kong
item.description: For the Lunar New Year, The Regent Hong Kong offers various culinary experiences: Hong Kong Cuisine 1983 Celebrate with symbolic à la carte dishes (HK$468 to HK$980) like Lohei (HK$580) for prosperity, prawns in salted egg yolk (HK$580) for wealth, and braised Wagyu beef cheek (HK$980) for strength. Their HK$438 Good Fortune Turnip Cake Gift Box contains two 800g turnip cakes, one traditional and one smoked with tea leaves, sugarcane, imperatae, and brown sugar.

item.title: Six Senses Hotels Resorts Spas in Vietnam have been recognized with accolades from TripAdvisor
item.description: Source: Six Senses Hotels Resorts Spas. The master bedroom of an oceanfront three-bedroom villa at Six Senses Con Dao, Vietnam. TripAdvisor, a leading travel platform, has revealed its highest-rated properties for the fourteenth consecutive year. These rankings are determined by analyzing user reviews and feedback from travelers globally over the past year. Three properties - Evason Ana Mandara, Six Senses Ninh Van Bay, and Six Senses Con Dao - have earned the prestigious Traveler’s Choice award, signifying TripAdvisor’s highest honor.

item.title: Travellers are pleased to engage with hotels on social media
item.description: A 2014 study by Accorhotels called the Social Media Monitor showed that hotels have a significant opportunity to connect with travelers on social media. In the Asia Pacific region, almost half of travelers follow hotel brands, more than airlines or other travel-related businesses. This trend is especially strong among travelers from China and Indonesia, as well as those between 25 and 44 years old. Interestingly, in countries with prominent airlines such as Malaysia, Australia, New Zealand, and Japan, airlines are followed most on social media.

item.title: Improve your sleep with the Sleep with Six Senses program
item.description: Source: Six Senses. Better sleep with the new Sleep with Six Senses programme. Six Senses partnered with Sleep Doctor Dr. Michael Breus to launch its improved sleep standard called Sleep With Six Senses. Currently, five resorts offer this standard, with complete implementation across all locations expected by mid-2017. All future resorts will feature this program from their opening day. The experience begins with a pre-arrival online questionnaire. This allows a designated Sleep Ambassador to understand the guest’s relationship with sleep and tailor the room accordingly.

item.title: Goodwood Park Hotel is ringing in the Lunar New Year with a wide array of delicious treats
item.description: Goodwood Park Hotel is celebrating the arrival of spring and Lunar New Year with a variety of festive treats, including yu sheng platters and savory specials, with a focus on the pineapple, a symbol of fortune. Among the delicious takeaway options are the Duo of Prosperity Fish, featuring mango with pomelo and sago, and durian pudding. The hotel’s pastry team has also created an impressive Auspicious Golden Pineapple vanilla pound cake and a large Huat!

item.title: Join us at the Pullman Jakarta Indonesia to celebrate the holy month of Ramadhan
item.description: The Pullman Jakarta Indonesia hotel has a special offer for corporate groups during Ramadan. For groups of 50 or more, they offer a deluxe Iftar (breaking the fast) package for Rp450,000 per person. This package features a selection of traditional Iftar snacks and drinks, along with an Indonesian buffet. To make a reservation or get more details, you can contact Ms. Sarat via email at H8491-SM4@accor.com or by phone at +62 21 3192 1111.

item.title: DAMAC Properties has revealed plans for three new serviced hotels in Dubai
item.description: High-end real estate company DAMAC Properties is expanding its presence in the hospitality sector with the addition of three new serviced hotels in Dubai’s Burj Area. Two of these hotels, Cour Jardin and Capital Bay, are scheduled to open within the next few months, while Canal Views is already operational and receiving guests. This initiative is part of DAMAC Properties’ goal to become the leading provider of serviced hotel apartments in the Middle East by 2018.

item.title: SilverNeedle Hospitality introduces the new Sage Hotel brand, catering specifically to upscale business travelers
item.description: SilverNeedle Hospitality, headquartered in Singapore, has introduced a new upscale hotel brand, Sage Hotel, tailored for business travelers. The first Sage Hotel will be located in Brisbane, Australia. Iqbal Jumabhoy, Managing Director & Group Chief Executive Officer at SilverNeedle Hospitality, stated, “We recognize a significant group of business travelers seeking a consistent and straightforward experience while working in unfamiliar cities.” He added, “Sage Hotel is designed to meet their needs and complements our existing portfolio of six brands.

item.title: The Jia Wei Chinese Restaurant is launching a fresh new menu
The Sanya EDITION is offering a promotion during Golden Week
item.description: The Sanya EDITION hotel is offering a special promotion for travelers visiting China during Golden Week, which falls on October 1st to 7th. To celebrate, the hotel is hosting guest chef Matthew David Ona from Roof 325 Restaurant and Bar in Shanghai. Chef Ona, known for his culinary expertise at one of Shanghai’s top dining destinations, will be at The Jade Egret restaurant from October 1st to 3rd. He has designed special steak and seafood tasting menus for the occasion.

This 30-story, five-star hotel showcases a sleek, all-glass exterior and sits at the crossroads of Changshou Road and Jiaozhou Road in Shanghai, China.

item.title: Experience an unexpected Christmas at Goodwood Park Hotel
item.description: Goodwood Park Hotel in Singapore has designed a Christmas menu featuring new versions of classic dishes, playful food presentations, and delightful surprises. These festive meals and unique takeaway options aim to make holiday celebrations even more memorable. This year’s new gourmet takeaway options center around turkey with unique Asian flavors for savory dishes and chocolate-focused sweet treats. Source: Goodwood Park Hotel. The 12 Treasures turkey is available for takeaways. 12 Treasures Turkey | S$268, serves eight to 10 people - New for 2017

item.title: Robots have been introduced to the teams at Hotel Jen in Singapore
item.description: Hotel Jen is pioneering the use of Savioke’s Relay robots in Asian hotels. The robots, Jeno and Jena, will be stationed at Hotel Jen Orchardgateway and Tanglin Singapore, respectively. They will handle deliveries of amenities and local food selections from the in-room dining menu. Cetin Sekercioglu, Executive VP of Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts, stated that Hotel Jen prioritizes technology that can improve efficiency and guest experiences. He believes that the robots will be valuable additions to the team and align with Hotel Jen’s playful and surprising brand identity.

item.title: Aloft Bangkok - Sukhumvit 11 now accepts e-signatures
item.description: Source: Aloft Bangkok - Sukhumvit 11 website. The Aloft Bangkok - Sukhumvit 11 has introduced a paperless check-in experience featuring electronic signatures. This system aims to eliminate the need for printed documents and expedite the arrival process for guests. Aloft Bangkok claims to be the first hotel within the Starwood brand to offer this service. This innovative approach streamlines the check-in procedure by presenting all reservation details on a tablet.

item.title: The Marina Mandarin Singapore welcomes the arrival of hairy crabs
item.description: Peach Blossoms, the renowned Cantonese restaurant located on the 5th level of Marina Mandarin Singapore, is now offering a seasonal delicacy flown in from Shanghai, China: hairy crabs. Also at the Marina Mandarin, on the 4th level, the AquaMarine buffet restaurant is spotlighting seafood until October 29th. Source: Meritus Hotels & Resorts. AquaMarine features an array of Asian dishes, including Vietnamese Braised Fish in Clay Pot, Thai Curry Mud Crab, authentic Filipino Beef Adobo, fresh Cambodian Fish Curry, and many more.

item.title: The Bazaar Desa buffet at Novotel KL City Centre is a celebration of street food
item.description: This Ramadan, enjoy the Bazaar Desa buffet at the Square restaurant in Novotel KL City Centre, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The buffet is available from June 20th to July 15th and will feature three rotating menus. Pictured above: grilled squid, the noodle station, an assortment of regional fruits, drinks such as khatirah, peach tea, bandung coconut, sugarcane juice, and sweetcorn juice, and marinated chicken perchik on shawarma. Executive Chef Huzaidy and their team have designed the Bazaar Desa buffet to showcase the diverse street food culture found throughout Malaysia during Ramadan.

item.title: Toyo Koda will enhance the menus at Le Passage Mohkan Shan
item.description: Source: Le Passage Mohkan Shan website. Le Passage Mohkan Shan, a French-style hotel and restaurant nestled in its own private tea plantation at the base of Moganshan* mountain in China, has appointed Toyo Koda as its new head chef. This strategic hire emphasizes the hotel’s aim to become a premier culinary destination in Asia. Chef Toyo, previously recognized as one of Asia’s top chefs by the San Pellegrino Restaurant Awards in 2013 for his role at Shanghai’s French restaurant Franck, is poised to transform the hotel’s culinary offerings.

item.title: Celebrate the year of the dog in a stylish manner at Pan Pacific Singapore
item.description: Starting January 22, 2018, ring in the Year of the Earth Dog and usher in new beginnings at the Pan Pacific Singapore. Hai Tien Lo Executive Chef Lai Tong Ping of Hai Tien Lo (海天楼) has crafted eight special reunion set menus, including a vegetarian option, to commemorate this Chinese New Year. From January 22nd to March 2nd, 2018, indulge in highlights like double-boiled fish maw with sea conch soup, bamboo pith, and Chinese cabbage, or savor the stewed classic whole abalone with sea cucumber in conpoy sauce.

item.title: The Presidential Villa is now available at Six Senses Qing Cheng Mountain
item.description: Source: Six Senses. Six Senses Qing Cheng Mountain resort. The Six Senses Qing Cheng Mountain resort is located near Dujiangyan, a UNESCO World Heritage & Natural Cultural site known as the home of giant pandas. Inspired by the region’s history as the birthplace of Taoism, Six Senses Qing Cheng Mountain introduces a new Presidential Villa. This villa embodies Taoist principles of living in harmony with nature, offering a space for reconnection and self-discovery.
